message: This king will block the path.
Now split the other black king in the same way.
This king will block one of the target squares.
Castle now in the same way you would castle in standard chess (by moving the king).
Since you cannot use castle to capture both targets must be empty.
For this reason, both target squares are collapsed and if something is blocking them then castling is not performed.
If castling is performed then the pieces along the way are entangled, as you can see with (righ-click).
As you can see, castling only occurs if no piece is blocking the way or the target squares.

initial_message: Castling works exaclty like in standard chess, but entanglement can occur and check-related restrictions are lifted (since there is no check in Quantum Chess).
Consider the queen side castle of standard chess.
To start, split the leftmost black king upwards and downwards.
